title: Quebec City is home to Canada's best new restaurant 2019
text:
ARVI in Quebec City is Canada's Best New Restaurant 2019

A restaurant in Quebec City described as an immersive dinner-theater experience has been named Canada's hottest new dining destination 2019 in Air Canada's annual restaurant ranking.

ARVI has topped the 18th edition of Canada's Best New Restaurants awards, organized by Air Canada's in-flight magazine enRoute.

At ARVI, guests are treated to a theatrical dining experience with front-row seats to an open kitchen, where French chef Julien Masia plays the lead role producing dishes like tataki-style veal rib-eye topped in an aged cheddar sauce, or Kohlrabi with beef and mustard in front of his house guests.

This year's ranking shines the spotlight heavily on addresses in British Columbia and Ontario and includes one stand-out restaurant representing Canada's North -- Whitehorse, Yukon's Wayfarer Oyster House, which occupies seventh spot.

Toronto landed three spots on the top 10 list, including Donna's, where roast pork is topped with endive and tarragon aioli and oven-baked sole bathes in a harissa and chili-reddened butter sauce.

Vancouver slides into second spot with its tapas restaurant Como Taperia.

The creation of the list starts with a pool of recommendations compiled by industry experts from across the country. The task then falls to an unnamed food critic who is sent on an epicurean mission who makes reservations under a pseudonym.

Here are Canada's best new restaurants of 2019:

ARVI, Quebec City

Como Taperia, Vancouver, BC

Donna's, Toronto

Pluvio restaurant + rooms, Ucluelet, BC

Nowhere* a restaurant, Victoria, BC

Dreyfus, Toronto

Wayfarer Oyster House, Whitehorse, Yukon

Pastel, Montreal

Dispatch, St. Catharines, Ontario

Ten, Toronto
